ArticleTitle.sentence: Specific complex formation between the type II bare lymphocyte syndrome-associated transactivators CIITA and RFX5.

event.clue: Specific complex formation between the type II bare lymphocyte syndrome-associated transactivators CIITA and RFX5.

AbstractText.sentence: Two of the genes defective in the five complementation groups identified in the class II-negative bare lymphocyte syndrome or corresponding laboratory mutants have been cloned.

event.clue: Two of the genes defective in the five complementation groups identified in the class II-negative bare lymphocyte syndrome or corresponding laboratory mutants have been cloned.
Two of the genes defective in the five complementation groups identified in the class II-negative bare lymphocyte syndrome or corresponding laboratory mutants have been cloned.
Two of the genes defective in the five complementation groups identified in the class II-negative bare lymphocyte syndrome or corresponding laboratory mutants have been cloned.
Two of the genes defective in the five complementation groups identified in the class II-negative bare lymphocyte syndrome or corresponding laboratory mutants have been cloned.

AbstractText.sentence: One gene encodes a protein, RFX5, that is a member of the RFX family of DNA binding proteins.
The other, CIITA, encodes a large protein with a defined acidic transcriptional activation domain; this protein does not interact with DNA.

event.clue: The other, CIITA, encodes a large protein with a defined acidic transcriptional activation domain; this protein does not interact with DNA.

AbstractText.sentence: Expression plasmids encoding regions of RFX5 fused to the GAL4 DNA binding domain activated transcription from a reporter construct containing GAL4 sites in a cotransfection assay in the Raji human B cell line.

event.clue: Expression plasmids encoding regions of RFX5 fused to the GAL4 DNA binding domain activated transcription from a reporter construct containing GAL4 sites in a cotransfection assay in the Raji human B cell line.

AbstractText.sentence: However, these plasmids produced transcriptional activity in HeLa cells only in conjunction with interferon gamma stimulation, a condition in which expression of both CIITA and class II major histocompatibility complex surface proteins are induced.

event.clue: However, these plasmids produced transcriptional activity in HeLa cells only in conjunction with interferon gamma stimulation, a condition in which expression of both CIITA and class II major histocompatibility complex surface proteins are induced.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, these plasmids were not active in RJ2.2.5, an in vitro mutagenized derivative of Raji in which both copies of CIITA are defective.

event.clue: Furthermore, these plasmids were not active in RJ2.2.5, an in vitro mutagenized derivative of Raji in which both copies of CIITA are defective.

AbstractText.sentence: Transcriptional activation by the RFX5 fusion protein could be restored in RJ2.2.5 by cotransfection with a CIITA expression plasmid.

event.clue: Transcriptional activation by the RFX5 fusion protein could be restored in RJ2.2.5 by cotransfection with a CIITA expression plasmid.
Transcriptional activation by the RFX5 fusion protein could be restored in RJ2.2.5 by cotransfection with a CIITA expression plasmid.

AbstractText.sentence: Finally, a direct interaction between RFX5 and CIITA was detected with the yeast two-hybrid and far-Western blot assays.

event.clue: Finally, a direct interaction between RFX5 and CIITA was detected with the yeast two-hybrid and far-Western blot assays.

AbstractText.sentence: Thus, RFX5 can activate transcription only in cooperation with CIITA.

event.clue: Thus, RFX5 can activate transcription only in cooperation with CIITA.

AbstractText.sentence: RFX5 and CIITA associate to form a complex capable of activating transcription from class II major histocompatibility complex promoters.

event.clue: RFX5 and CIITA associate to form a complex capable of activating transcription from class II major histocompatibility complex promoters.
RFX5 and CIITA associate to form a complex capable of activating transcription from class II major histocompatibility complex promoters.

AbstractText.sentence: In this complex, promoter specificity is determined by the DNA binding domain of RFX5 and the general transcription apparatus is recruited by the acidic activation domain of CIITA.

event.clue: In this complex, promoter specificity is determined by the DNA binding domain of RFX5 and the general transcription apparatus is recruited by the acidic activation domain of CIITA.
